TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SiteAuthSettings extends Azure.ResourceManager.Models.ResourceData

Docs.summary: Configuration settings for the Azure App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of SiteAuthSettings.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AadClaimsAuthorization : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets a JSON string containing the Azure AD Acl settings.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AdditionalLoginParams As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: Login parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint when a user logs in. Each parameter must be in the form "key=value".

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AllowedAudiences As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: Allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by Azure Active Directory. Note that the ClientID value is always considered an allowed audience, regardless of this setting.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AllowedExternalRedirectUrls As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: External URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging in or logging out of the app. Note that the query string part of the URL is ignored. This is an advanced setting typically only needed by Windows Store application backends. Note that URLs within the current domain are always implicitly allowed.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AuthFilePath : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The path of the config file containing auth settings. If the path is relative, base will the site's root directory.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ClientId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The Client ID of this relying party application, known as the client_id. This setting is required for enabling OpenID Connection authentication with Azure Active Directory or other 3rd party OpenID Connect providers. More information on OpenID Connect: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ClientSecret : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The Client Secret of this relying party application (in Azure Active Directory, this is also referred to as the Key). This setting is optional. If no client secret is configured, the OpenID Connect implicit auth flow is used to authenticate end users. Otherwise, the OpenID Connect Authorization Code Flow is used to authenticate end users. More information on OpenID Connect: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ClientSecretCertificateThumbprint : BinaryData with get, set
member this.ClientSecretCertificateThumbprint : string with get, set

Docs.summary:
An alternative to the client secret, that is the thumbprint of a certificate used for signing purposes. This property acts as a replacement for the Client Secret. It is also optional.
To assign an object to this property use .
To assign an already formated json string to this property use .
Examples:
BinaryData.FromObjectAsJson("foo")Creates a payload of "foo".
BinaryData.FromString("\"foo\"")Creates a payload of "foo".
BinaryData.FromObjectAsJson(new { key = "value" })Creates a payload of { "key": "value" }.
BinaryData.FromString("{\"key\": \"value\"}")Creates a payload of { "key": "value" }.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ClientSecretSettingName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The app setting name that contains the client secret of the relying party application.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ConfigVersion : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The ConfigVersion of the Authentication / Authorization feature in use for the current app. The setting in this value can control the behavior of the control plane for Authentication / Authorization.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property DefaultProvider As Nullable(Of BuiltInAuthenticationProvider)

Docs.summary: The default authentication provider to use when multiple providers are configured. This setting is only needed if multiple providers are configured and the unauthenticated client action is set to "RedirectToLoginPage".

MemberSignature.Value: member this.FacebookAppId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The App ID of the Facebook app used for login. This setting is required for enabling Facebook Login. Facebook Login documentation: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login

MemberSignature.Value: member this.FacebookAppSecret : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The App Secret of the Facebook app used for Facebook Login. This setting is required for enabling Facebook Login. Facebook Login documentation: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login

MemberSignature.Value: member this.FacebookAppSecretSettingName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The app setting name that contains the app secret used for Facebook Login.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FacebookOAuthScopes As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Facebook Login authentication. This setting is optional. Facebook Login documentation: https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login

MemberSignature.Value: member this.GitHubClientId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The Client Id of the GitHub app used for login. This setting is required for enabling Github login

MemberSignature.Value: member this.GitHubClientSecret : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The Client Secret of the GitHub app used for Github Login. This setting is required for enabling Github login.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.GitHubClientSecretSettingName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The app setting name that contains the client secret of the Github app used for GitHub Login.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property GitHubOAuthScopes As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of GitHub Login authentication. This setting is optional

MemberSignature.Value: member this.GoogleClientId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The OpenID Connect Client ID for the Google web application. This setting is required for enabling Google Sign-In. Google Sign-In documentation: https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/

MemberSignature.Value: member this.GoogleClientSecret : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The client secret associated with the Google web application. This setting is required for enabling Google Sign-In. Google Sign-In documentation: https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/

MemberSignature.Value: member this.GoogleClientSecretSettingName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The app setting name that contains the client secret associated with the Google web application.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property GoogleOAuthScopes As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Google Sign-In authentication. This setting is optional. If not specified, "openid", "profile", and "email" are used as default scopes. Google Sign-In documentation: https://developers.google.com/identity/sign-in/web/

MemberSignature.Value: member this.IsAuthFromFile : string with get, set

Docs.summary: "true" if the auth config settings should be read from a file, "false" otherwise

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property IsEnabled As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.IsEnabled : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: true if the Authentication / Authorization feature is enabled for the current app; otherwise, false.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Issuer : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens for this application. When using Azure Active Directory, this value is the URI of the directory tenant, e.g. https://sts.windows.net/{tenant-guid}/. This URI is a case-sensitive identifier for the token issuer. More information on OpenID Connect Discovery: http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property IsTokenStoreEnabled As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.IsTokenStoreEnabled : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: true to durably store platform-specific security tokens that are obtained during login flows; otherwise, false. The default is false.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Kind : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Kind of resource.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.MicrosoftAccountClientId : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The OAuth 2.0 client ID that was created for the app used for authentication. This setting is required for enabling Microsoft Account authentication. Microsoft Account OAuth documentation: https://dev.onedrive.com/auth/msa_oauth.htm

MemberSignature.Value: member this.MicrosoftAccountClientSecret : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the app used for authentication. This setting is required for enabling Microsoft Account authentication. Microsoft Account OAuth documentation: https://dev.onedrive.com/auth/msa_oauth.htm
The app setting name containing the OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the app used for authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MicrosoftAccountOAuthScopes As IList(Of String)

Docs.summary: The OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Microsoft Account authentication. This setting is optional. If not specified, "wl.basic" is used as the default scope. Microsoft Account Scopes and permissions documentation: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn631845.aspx

MemberSignature.Value: member this.RuntimeVersion : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The RuntimeVersion of the Authentication / Authorization feature in use for the current app. The setting in this value can control the behavior of certain features in the Authentication / Authorization module.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property TokenRefreshExtensionHours As Nullable(Of Double)
member this.TokenRefreshExtensionHours : Nullable<double> with get, set

Docs.summary: The number of hours after session token expiration that a session token can be used to call the token refresh API. The default is 72 hours.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TwitterConsumerKey : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The OAuth 1.0a consumer key of the Twitter application used for sign-in. This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In. Twitter Sign-In documentation: https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TwitterConsumerSecret : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in. This setting is required for enabling Twitter Sign-In. Twitter Sign-In documentation: https://dev.twitter.com/web/sign-in

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TwitterConsumerSecretSettingName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The app setting name that contains the OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property UnauthenticatedClientAction As Nullable(Of UnauthenticatedClientAction)

Docs.summary: The action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the app.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property ValidateIssuer As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.ValidateIssuer : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the issuer should be a valid HTTPS url and be validated as such.
